RTCDataChannelStats.summary: The RTCDataChannelStats dictionary of the WebRTC API provides statistics related to one object on the connection.

remarks.para: The report can be obtained by iterating the returned by until you find an entry with the type of data-channel.
The data channels statistics may be correlated to a particular channel by comparing the dataChannelIdentifier property to a matching .

RTCDataChannelStatsBytesReceived.summary: The bytesReceived property of the dictionary returns the total number of payload bytes received on the associated .

remarks.para: Note that non-payload bytes, such as those for framing and in headers, are not included.

RTCDataChannelStatsBytesReceived.value: A positive integer value indicating the total number of payload bytes received on the associated data channel.

RTCDataChannelStatsBytesSent.summary: The bytesSent property of the dictionary returns the total number of payload bytes sent on the associated .

remarks.para: Note that non-payload bytes, such as those for framing and in headers, are not included.

RTCDataChannelStatsBytesSent.value: A positive integer value indicating the total number of payload bytes sent on the associated data channel.

RTCDataChannelStatsDataChannelIdentifier.summary: The dataChannelIdentifier property of the dictionary containing the of the associated RTCDataChannel providing these statistics.

remarks.para: Using the dataChannelIdentifier, you can correlate this statistics object to a particular .

RTCDataChannelStatsDataChannelIdentifier.value: A string containing the same value as the property of the associated data channel.

RTCDataChannelStatsId.summary: The id property of the dictionary is a string that uniquely identifies the object for which this object provides statistics.

remarks.para: Using the id, you can correlate this statistics object with others, in order to monitor statistics over time for a given WebRTC object, such as an , or an .

RTCDataChannelStatsId.value: A string that uniquely identifies the object for which this RTCDataChannelStats object provides statistics.The format of the ID string is not defined by the specification, so you cannot reliably make any assumptions about the contents of the string, or assume that the format of the string will remain unchanged for a given object type.

RTCDataChannelStatsLabel.summary: The label property of the dictionary returns the of the associated data channel.

remarks.para: The value of the label need not be unique, and its meaning is defined by the website or app when it creates the data channel.

RTCDataChannelStatsLabel.value: A string containing the same value as the property of the associated data channel.

RTCDataChannelStatsMessagesReceived.summary: The messagesReceived property of the dictionary returns the total number of message events fired for received messages on the associated .
RTCDataChannelStatsMessagesReceived.value: A positive integer value indicating the total number of message events for inbound data on the associated data channel.

RTCDataChannelStatsMessagesSent.summary: The messagesSent property of the dictionary returns the total number of message events fired for sent messages on the associated .
RTCDataChannelStatsMessagesSent.value: A positive integer value indicating the total number of message events for outbound data on the associated data channel.

RTCDataChannelStatsProtocol.summary: The protocol property of the dictionary returns a string containing the of the associated data channel.

remarks.para: The value is defined by the website or app when it creates the data channel.

RTCDataChannelStatsProtocol.value: A string containing the same value as the property of the associated data channel.If no protocol was defined, this will be the empty string ("").

RTCDataChannelStatsState.summary: The state property of the RTCDataChannelStats dictionary returns a string that indicates the of the data channel's underlying data connection: connecting, open, closing or closed.

remarks.para: Note that this property is required.

RTCDataChannelStatsState.value: A string containing the same value as the property of the associated data channel.

RTCDataChannelStatsTimestamp.summary: The timestamp property of the dictionary is a object specifying the time at which the data in the object was sampled.
RTCDataChannelStatsTimestamp.value: A value indicating the time at which the activity described by the statistics in this object was recorded, in milliseconds elapsed since the beginning of January 1, 1970, UTC.The value should be accurate to within a few milliseconds but may not be entirely precise, either because of hardware or operating system limitations or because of fingerprinting protection in the form of reduced clock precision or accuracy.

RTCDataChannelStatsType.summary: The type property of the dictionary is a string with the value "data-channel".

remarks.para:
Different statistics are obtained by iterating the object returned by a call to .
The type indicates the set of statistics available through the object in a particular iteration step.
A value of "data-channel" indicates that the statistics available in the current step are those defined in .
